intro: Marsdenia tholiformis, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a fleshy, orange-red berry that contains several seeds. Marsdenia tholiformis is often found growing on rocky slopes and in forested areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
